original: All history shows: idioms of dominant states often lead to the disappearance of the languages of the dominated states. Greek engulfed the Phrygian. Latin killed the Iberian and Gallic. Currently, 25 languages are disappearing every year! Understand one thing: I'm not fighting against English, I fight for diversity. An Armenian proverb wonderfully summarizes my thought: "The more languages you know, the more you are a person."
translated: Toute l'Histoire le montre : les idiomes des Etats dominants conduisent souvent à la disparition de ceux des Etats dominés. Le grec a englouti le phrygien. Le latin a tué l'ibère et le gaulois. A l'heure actuelle, 25 langues disparaissent chaque année ! Comprenez bien une chose : je ne me bats pas contre l'anglais ; je me bats pour la diversité. Un proverbe arménien résume merveilleusement ma pensée : « Autant tu connais de langues, autant de fois tu es un homme. »

original: One of the reasons Twitter is popular in Japan is a characteristic of Japanese itself: Japanese uses ideograms which enable it to convey more information in just 140 characters than other languages, not counting Chinese. Incidentally, the Japanese version of this sentence is written with exactly 140 characters. How many characters does it take in other languages?
translated: Une des raisons qui font le succès de Twitter au Japon tient à une particularité de la langue japonaise. Comparé à bien d’autres langues, le japonais, avec ses idéogrammes, peut véhiculer beaucoup d’informations en 140 caractères, sans pour autant rivaliser avec le chinois. À propos, la version japonaise de cette phrase s’écrit en exactement 140 caractères. Mais combien de caractères cela fait-il donc dans les autres langues ?

original: So let there be no doubt: Islam is a part of America. These things we share. This is the hope of all humanity.
translated: Aussi qu'il n'y ait aucun doute : L'Islam fait partie de l'Amérique. Et je crois que l'Amérique recèle la vérité qu'indépendamment de la race, de la religion ou de l'état, nous partageons tous des aspirations communes - vivre en paix et en sécurité ; avoir une éducation et travailler dans la dignité ; aimer nos familles, nos communautés et notre Dieu. original: I'm probably not the only one that needs to do that.

original: She wore a blue skirt.

original: Nonsense!

original: This clock is mine.

original: Follow the example of your sister.

original: Did you hear the news?

original: I'd be disappointed if I saw you doing that.

original: There is a long wait between trains.

original: Be sure to turn out the light when you go out.
translated: N'oublie pas d'éteindre la lumière en sortant.

original: Mary and Tom live together.

original: The goal of this report is to examine every advantage and disadvantage of this proposal.

original: I'm not accountable to you for my conduct.

original: See you tomorrow.

original: She's a determined woman.

original: I was arrested on the spot.
translated: J'ai été arrêté sur-le-champ.

original: What do you say we go for a swim?

original: She wept the entire night.
translated: Elle pleura toute la nuit.

original: Do you want us to take you home with us?
translated: Veux-tu que nous te ramenions à la maison ?

original: My ass!

original: We need flour, sugar and eggs to make this cake.
translated: Nous avons besoin de farine, de sucre et d'œufs pour la recette de ce gâteau.

original: Did you?

original: After Saturday comes Sunday.
translated: Après le samedi vient le dimanche.

original: No army is a match for a dragon.
translated: Aucune armée ne peut rivaliser avec un dragon.

original: We chopped a tree down.
translated: Nous avons abattu un arbre.

original: Can you translate a love letter?

original: The knife isn't sharp.
translated: Le couteau n'est pas aiguisé.

original: It's the right thing to do.

original: At his young age, he has already accomplished a lot.
translated: Pour son jeune âge, il a déjà beaucoup accompli.

original: I'm sure I can persuade Tom.

original: Are you sure it's hers?

original: His comments about the book were favorable.

original: I'd like to open an account.

original: The movie was so dull that the audience left one by one.

original: The right is on my side.

original: He likes to swim.

original: You should be more careful next time.

original: I love this language.

original: You cannot have your cake and eat it, too.

original: Even though she was busy, she came to see me.
translated: Bien qu'elle fut occupée, elle est venue me voir.

original: Is there something you want to tell me?

original: You're going?

original: And what do you know about it?

original: I'd like it if we could spend more time together.
translated: J'aimerais que nous puissions passer davantage de temps ensemble.

original: Instead, they prefer to stay in and watch television.
translated: Au lieu de cela, ils préfèrent rester à l'intérieur et regarder la télévision.

original: I'm looking forward to seeing you dance.
translated: Je suis impatiente de te voir danser.

original: What'll it be like?

original: He was unaware of the situation.

original: I made myself a cup of hot chocolate.

original: I need thread to sew on this button.
translated: Il me faut du fil pour coudre ce bouton.

original: They don't like my friends.

original: I'm finished.

original: Don't be long.

original: I often catch colds.

original: Don't blame another for his faults.

original: I have known John since 1976.

original: I'll take a rain check on that.

original: Tom has never milked a cow.

original: Where's the bass player?
translated: Où est le bassiste ?

original: She has been sick since last week.
translated: Elle a été malade depuis la semaine dernière.

original: I need to buy a muzzle for my dog.
translated: Je dois acheter une muselière pour mon chien.

original: He went to the library.
translated: Il est allé à la bibliothèque.

original: I think that you are twenty years old.
translated: Je pense que tu as vingt ans.

original: Tamazight is a family of languages ​​spoken in North Africa.
translated: Tamazight est une famille de langues parlées en Afrique du nord.

original: You'll lose anyway.
translated: Vous perdrez de toute façon.

original: I was at your wedding.
translated: J'étais à ton mariage.

original: Everything I own is in this suitcase.
translated: Tous ce que je possède est dans cette valise.

original: How many have you killed?

original: You should at least wear a tie.
translated: Tu devrais au moins porter une cravate.

original: The best way is to take things as they come.
translated: Le mieux est de laisser couler l'eau.
